title: `cast` <> Truffle Dashboard
body:
### Component

`cast`

### Describe the feature you would like

[Truffle Dashboard](https://trufflesuite.com/docs/truffle/how-to/use-the-truffle-dashboard) is a very convenient tool that lets you deploy and interact without putting your private key into a `.env` file. Unfortunately, currently, it's _not_ possible to interact with the Truffle Dashboard due to an underlying problem with MetaMask:

- https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/11824
- https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/issues/18076
- https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/3890

_TL;DR:_ MetaMask supports the tx type `0x2` but not `0x02` which in turn makes it incompatible with the `ethers-rs` library.

I have created this issue to track the status of the ongoing issue(s) and once resolved it should be properly tested and validated, and eventually, I propose to add a small section to the docs. I feel like this is an important part to highlight the advantages of non-`.env`-file-based development.

### Additional context

See my tweet [here](https://twitter.com/pcaversaccio/status/1664930332175478784) about why `.env` files are bad practice.
